key_risks: Market and economic volatility impacting alternative asset classes
Regulatory and compliance risks from entities like the SEC and FCA
Fee compression due to intense industry competition
Declining incentive fees and reliance on performance-based revenue
Negative Q1 2023 earnings and profitability challenges
controversies: Short interest surge by 43.3% in December 2023, indicating bearish sentiment
Potential criticism regarding the depth and effectiveness of ESG initiatives
environmental_issues: Need to demonstrate measurable impact of ESG initiatives to avoid greenwashing accusations
social_issues: Integration of ESG considerations into investment processes since 2015
governance_issues: Ongoing regulatory scrutiny and compliance risks
Corporate governance under the oversight of the Global Chief Compliance Officer

sources.title: GCM Grosvenor - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: GCM Grosvenor was founded in 1971 by Richard Elden and managed the first fund of hedge funds in the United States. [9] In 1973, Elden brought on a partner, Frank Meyer, who had been a colleague at A.G. Becker. [10] Elden left GCM Grosvenor in 2006 to start Lakeview Investment Manager, which runs an activist fund of hedge funds, and Meyer retired from the business.
